function_reachability: Is there a call path from function 'main' to function 'printf'?
Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'main'?
loop_reachability: Is it possible that the loop with condition 'i < argc' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition 'i < argc' always executed?
Is it possible that the loop with condition 'i < num_states' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition 'i < num_states' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i < argc' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i < num_states' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Does the value assigned to 'argc (line 2)' affect subsequent computations?
Does the value assigned to 'argv (line 2)' affect subsequent computations?
liveness: Does variable 'states' remain in use at the end of function 'main'?
Does variable 'k' remain in use at the end of function 'main'?
dead_code: Can the statement 'int j =0;' be considered dead code?
